projectPurpose: To provide a software platform for building distributed systems that offer meaningful control of data and externally verifiable claims about system behaviors, focusing on security, privacy, and transparent trustworthiness.
mainFeatures: Meaningful control of data in distributed systems
Provides externally verifiable (or falsifiable) claims about system behaviors
Enables transparent trustworthiness in distributed environments
Software platform for building distributed systems

alternatives.name: Open Enclave SDK
mainFeatures: Unified API for multiple TEEs (Intel SGX, ARM TrustZone, AMD SEV)

alternatives.name: Confidential Containers
mainFeatures: Protect containers and data using TEEs
Support for multiple TEE and hardware platforms

alternatives.name: Intel SGX SDK
mainFeatures: Tools for developing applications for Intel SGX enclaves

alternatives.name: Azure Confidential Computing
mainFeatures: Protects data in use using hardware-based TEEs

alternatives.name: Google Cloud Confidential Computing
mainFeatures: Utilizes AMD and Intel TEE technologies

alternatives.name: Edgeless Systems EGo
mainFeatures: SDK for Go applications in enclaves
Attestation and sealing for Go apps

alternatives.name: Secure Multiparty Computation (MPC) Frameworks (e.g., MP-SPDZ)
mainFeatures: Different protocols for varying security guarantees

alternatives.name: Distributed Ledger Technologies (DLT) with Privacy Features (e.g., Hyperledger Fabric)

marketPositioning: Project Oak positions itself as a foundational software platform for building distributed systems with a strong emphasis on meaningful data control and verifiable system behavior. Unlike some confidential computing solutions that primarily focus on protecting data in use within enclaves, Oak adds a layer of transparency and verifiability, allowing external parties to gain confidence in the computation's integrity and correctness within a distributed environment. This unique focus on verifiable claims about system behavior, in addition to data privacy, sets it apart from general-purpose confidential computing SDKs or cloud offerings and positions it for use cases requiring a higher level of trust and auditability in distributed data processing.
